articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Meets Chinese Vice-Premier
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Meets Chinese Vice-Premier
Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- Choe Yong Rim, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and premier of the DPRK Cabinet, who is on an unofficial working visit to the northeastern region of China, met and had a talk with Zhang Dejiang, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., the Communist Party of China and vice-premier of the State Council of China, in Changchun, Jilin Province on Nov. 3. 
					 Present there were Vice-Premier Ro Tu Chol and other entourage of the DPRK premier and Sun Zhengcai, secretary of the Jilin Provincial Committee of the CPC, Wang Yulin, governor of the Jilin Provincial People's Government, Hu Zhengyue, assistant to the foreign minister, Liu Hongcai, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, and others.
					
					 Zhang Dejiang said that the Chinese party and government warmly welcomed the visit of the DPRK premier and his party.
					
					 He noted that the traditional Sino-DPRK friendship provided by revolutionaries of the elder generation of the two countries is the wealth common to the two parties, governments and peoples.
					
					 The two countries significantly commemorated the 65th birthday of the WPK and the 60th anniversary of the Chinese People's Volunteers' entry into the Korean front, he said, stressing that steadfast is the stance of the Chinese party and government supporting the DPRK.
					
					 He expressed conviction that under the leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il the army and people of the DPRK would open the gate to a great prosperous and powerful nation through single-minded unity.
					
					 That day the government of China hosted a reception in honor of Choe and his party.

articles.title: Raul Castro Ruz Meets DPRK Military Delegation
articles.content:
Raul Castro Ruz Meets DPRK Military Delegation
Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- Raul Castro Ruz, second secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba, president of the Council of State and president of the Council of Ministers of Cuba, Wednesday met and had a talk with the DPRK military delegation led by Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Ri Yong Ho, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea and chief of the General Staff of the KPA, at the building of the Council of Ministers.
					 Referring to the fact that he was deeply impressed to visit the DPRK, Raul Castro Ruz said that Cuba attaches great importance to the development of the friendly and cooperative relations with the DPRK.
					
					 Meanwhile, a ceremony of conferring the Order of Solidarity upon Ri Yong Ho, head of the DPRK military delegation, and Commemorative Medal of Service upon the members of the delegation was held in Havana.

articles.title: Talks between Military Delegations of DPRK and Cuba Held
articles.content:
Talks between Military Delegations of DPRK and Cuba Held
Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- Talks between the military delegations of the DPRK and Cuba took place in Havana on Nov. 3.
					 Present there from the DPRK side were members of the DPRK military delegation led by Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Ri Yong Ho, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea and chief of the General Staff of the KPA, Kwon Sung Chol, DPRK ambassador to Cuba, and the military attache of his embassy and from the Cuban side Alvaro Lopez Miera, viceÔºçminister of Revolutionary Armed Forces of Cuba who doubles as chief of the General Staff of Revolutionary Armed Forces of Cuba, and officials of the ministry and the General Staff of Revolutionary Armed Forces of Cuba. 
					
					 At the talks both sides informed each other of the situation of their countries and exchanged views on the issue of boosting the friendly relations between the two armies and peoples and reached a consensus on the matters discussed.

articles.title: Gift from Laul Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Gift from Laul Castro Ruz
Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by Raul Castro Ruz, second secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba, president of the Council of State and president of the Council of Ministers.
					 The gift was conveyed on Nov. 3 to Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Ri Yong Ho, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea and chief of the General Staff of the KPA who is heading a DPRK military delegation on a visit to Cuba, by Raul Castro Ruz.

articles.title: Gift from Ministry of Revolutionary Armed Forces of Cuba
articles.content:
Gift from Ministry of Revolutionary Armed Forces of Cuba
Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the Ministry of Revolutionary Armed Forces of Cuba congratulating him on his reelection as general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					 The gift was handed over by Alvaro Lopez Miera, vice-minister of Revolutionary Armed Forces of Cuba who is chief of the General Staff of the Revolutionary Armed Forces of Cuba, on Wednesday to Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Ri Yong Ho, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of the Workers' Party of Korea and chief of the General Staff of the KPA who is heading the military delegation of the DPRK now on a visit to Cuba.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets New Indonesian Ambassador
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets New Indonesian Ambassador
Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday met and had a talk with Nasri Gustaman, new Indonesian ambassador to the DPRK, who paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.

articles.title: Russian Guests Here
articles.content:
Russian Guests Here
Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- Aleksandr Sokolov, mayor of Khabarovsk in Russia, and his party arrived here on Thursday.

articles.title: National Art Exhibition Held
articles.content:
National Art Exhibition Held
Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- A national art exhibition took place at Pyongyang Indoor Stadium to mark the recently held historic conference of the Workers' Party of Korea and the 65th WPK anniversary.
					 The art show brought together more than 400 fine art works featuring the undying feats President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il performed for founding and developing the party as well as the strong will of the Korean army and the people to be always faithful to the party.
					
					 Typical of them were a sculpture "The Great Leader Declaring Party Founding", a Korean painting "Dawn" and an oil painting "Great Events Brought to the Country by Leader Kim Jong Il".
					
					 Such works as Korean paintings "Looking Up to Sun" and "Application for Party Membership" provide a glimpse of the WPK's development.
					
					 A Korean painting "Military Post at Night" and an oil painting "At a Stroke" portray servicepersons and civilians displaying the revolutionary spirit in the building of a thriving nation under the uplifted banner of Songun.
					
					 Also put on display at the exhibition were art works showing the Huichon and Orangchon power stations now under construction.
					
					 The exhibition strikingly demonstrated the Korean people's will to successfully accomplish the revolutionary cause of Juche under the leadership of the great party headed by Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: National Program Contest and Exhibition Closed
articles.content:
National Program Contest and Exhibition Closed
Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- The 21st national program contest and exhibition, which opened on October 28, was closed with due ceremony at the Three-Revolution Exhibition Thursday.
					 In the period, there were contests and exhibitions of various programs including the program for translating English into Korean, IT service, etc.
					
					 In the section of exhibition the Ministry of Foreign Trade, the Ministry of Metal Industry and others were highly estimated for having distinguished themselves in putting the management and production processes on a computer basis. Meanwhile Kim Chaek University of Technology and the Pyongyang Information Center proved successful in the section of contest.
					
					 High appreciation went to those who developed the programs conducive to updating of production processes at the Pyongyang Cornstarch Factory, including the putting of confectionary production process on a CNC basis.
					
					 Present at the closing ceremony were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Jon Ha Chol, vice-premier of the Cabinet, Kim Yong Jin, chairman of the Education Commission, Ri Ja Bang, chairman of the State Science and Technology Commission, officials concerned and program developers.
					
					 Ri Ja Bang made a closing address.

articles.title: Foodstuff Factories Show Growth of Production
articles.content:
Foodstuff Factories Show Growth of Production
Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- The foodstuff output has been on the increase in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea. 
					 The Jangjasan Combined Foodstuff Factory has drawn up a scientific management and business strategy and put the supply of raw and other materials and the management of equipment and labour on a rational basis to operate the CNC-based production processes at full capacity.
					
					 It has also strictly observed the technical rules and standard regulations in washing, cutting, saucing and all other processes to improve the quality of the products.
					
					 The Jongbangsan Combined Foodstuff Factory has produced large quantities of nutritive and tasty things such as gingko leave tea, barley tea, cookie, bread, noodle and millet jelly.
					
					 The factory is now updating the packing material production process.
					
					 The Chongbong Combined Foodstuff Factory produces pickles with such edible herbs as Aster scaber, Ligularia fischeri and Codonopsis lanceolata.
					
					 Increased production has also been reported from other foodstuff factories throughout the country.

articles.title: Stop to Suppression of Reunification Movement Organizations Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Stop to Suppression of Reunification Movement Organizations Urged in S. Korea
Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification released a statement on Oct. 29 in which it urged the puppet authorities to stop their harsh crackdown upon the reunification movement organizations. 
					 The statement disclosed that the Defense Security Command searched the house of the vice-chairwoman of the Ansan City Committee of the Democratic Labor Party over her husband's career in reunification movement by invoking the "Security Law" and that the Security Investigation Group made inquires about Ri Thae Hyong, co-executive chairman of the Inchon Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration.
					
					 The present regime's crackdown upon members of the progressive organizations is intended to totally eliminate the pro-reunification democratic forces, it pointed out. 
					
					 The statement warned that the present authorities, who have surpassed the successive dictatorial regimes in fascist suppression, would meet shower of revenge from the people.
					
					 The collapse of Lee Myung Bak and the "Grand National Party" is inevitable, it said, adding that the progressive forces and other people would surely punish the fascist regime by the united efforts of the Korean nation. 
					
					 Meanwhile the Media Headquarters and the Academic Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing June 15 Joint Declaration made public a joint statement on the same day, denouncing the puppet authorities' crackdown on the Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration. 
					
					 The statement accused the security authorities of having searched the houses of former and incumbent members of the Solidarity and detained its Executive Chairman Mun Kyong Hwan and intensifying such crackdown.
					
					 Lurking behind the successive suppression of the security authorities is a sinister intention to create terror-ridden atmosphere among the people and quell their growing desire for reunification, the statement said.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Undisguised Plot to Escalate Confrontation with DPRK Slashed
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Undisguised Plot to Escalate Confrontation with DPRK Slashed
Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- The puppet authorities of south Korea formally joined the experts group for steering the PSI on Nov. 1. 
					 The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors hell-bent on confrontation with fellow countrymen from the very day of their seizure of power officially announced south Korea's full participation in the PSI little short of the declaration of a war against the DPRK on May 26, 2009.
					
					 Some days ago the Lee group of traitors frantically kicked up an anti-DPRK confrontation racket, staging PSI maritime interception and search exercises in the waters off Pusan in collusion with the U.S. and Japan.
					
					 It was against this backdrop that the group of traitors formally joined the above-said group, the core of the mechanism for aggression, blustering that "this would significantly help intensify the participation in the PSI exercises and activities in the future."
					
					 The reckless actions of the Lee Myung Bak group are triggering off strong resentment among all Koreans as it has become evermore undisguised in its moves to escalate the confrontation with the DPRK, thoughtlessly taking advantage of the U.S. policy of blockading and stifling it by force of arms.

articles.title: Story of Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Story of Kim Jong Suk
Pyongyang, November 4 (KCNA) -- One spring day in Juche 35 (1946) anti-Japanese heroine Kim Jong Suk made a visit to the home of a woman whose husband was devoting himself to the struggle for national reunification.
					 Picking lettuces in the vegetable garden together with the woman, Kim Jong Suk told her that Korea had not yet been reunified as the U.S. imperialists were lording it over south Korea instead of the defeated Japanese imperialists.
					
					 She also said that she was much worried about the south Korean people undergoing all sorts of harships under the control of the U.S. imperialist aggression forces though Korea was liberated from the Japanese colonial rule and that the entire Korean people should unite closely around President Kim Il Sung in the struggle to drive the U.S. imperialists out of south Korea and reunify the country at an early date.
					
					 Reflected in the remark was her deep concern about the south Korean people's sufferings from the division of the nation by outside forces.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim se reune con vicepremier chino en Changchun
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim se reune con vicepremier chino en Changchun 
Pyongyang, 4 de noviembre (ATCC) -- El miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del CC del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Choe Yong Rim, de vista de trabajo no oficial en la region nordeste de China, departio el dia 3 en la ciudad de Changchun de la provincia de Jilin con el miembro del Buro Politico del CC del Partido Comunista de China y viceprimer ministro del Consejo de Estado de la Republica Popular China, Zhang Dejiang. 
					   Estuvieron presentes la comitiva del premier coreano incluso el vicepremier Ro Tu Chol, el secretario del Comite Provincial del PCCh en Jilin, Sun Zhengcai, el gobernador del gobierno popular de la provincia de Jilin, Wang Yulin, el asistente del ministro de Relaciones Exteriores Hu Zhengyue, el embajador chino en Corea Liu Hongcai, etc.
					
					   En la ocasion Zhang Dejiang dijo que el partido y el gobierno de China dan calurosa bienvenida a la visita del premier coreano y su comitiva.
					
					   Se refirio a que la tradicional amistad China-Corea, preparada por los revolucionarios de veterana generacion de los dos paises, es la riqueza comun de los partidos, los gobiernos y los pueblos de ambos paises. 
					
					   China y Corea han celebrado solemnemente el 65o aniversario de la fundacion del PTC y el 60o de la participacion del Cuerpo de Voluntarios del Pueblo Chino en el frente coreano, afirmo y recalco que es invariable la posicion del partido y el gobierno de China que apoyan a Corea. 
					
					   Expreso la conviccion de que bajo la direccion del Secretario General Kim Jong Il, el ejercito y el pueblo coreanos, unidos monoliticamente, abriran las puertas a la gran potencia prospera. 
					
					   El mismo dia, el gobierno chino ofrecio un banquete en honor de Choe Yong Rim y su comitiva.

articles.title: Premier coreano envia telegrama de consuelo a su homologo tailandes
articles.content:
Premier coreano envia telegrama de consuelo a su homologo tailandes
Pyongyang, 4 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Choe Ryong Rim, primer  ministro del Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, envio el dia 3 un telegrama de condolencias a Abhisit Vejjajiva, primer ministro del Reino de Tailandia en relacion con que este pais asiatico sufrio grandes perdidas humadas y materiales por grandes inundaciones producidas al cabo de 50  anos.
					  El remitente expresa profunda simpatia y condolencias al destinatario, los danados y los familiares de los difuntos y desea que el gobierno tailandes estabilizara la vida de los habitantes de la zona damnificada eliminando lo mas pronto posible las consecuencias de las calamidades naturales.

articles.title: Clausurado 21o concurso-exposicion nacional de programas
articles.content:
Clausurado 21o concurso-exposicion nacional de programas
Pyongyang, 4 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Quedo clausurado este jueves en la Exposicion Permanente de las Tres Revoluciones el 21o Concurso-Exposicion Nacional de Programas, inaugurado el 28 de octubre.
					  En este certamen se realizaron los concursos, exposiciones y el servicio de la IT sobre el programa de traduccion mecanica del ingles en coreano y otros programas.
					
					  En la rama de exposicion gozaron de buena reputacion el Ministerio de Comercio Exterior, el de Industria Metalurgica, etc. que sirvieron de ejemplo en la computarizacion de las actividades de gestion y de los procesos de produccion, y en la de concurso, la Universidad Politecnica Kim Chaek y el Centro de Informatica de Pyongyang, respectivamente.
					
					  Tambien fueron apreciados los desarrolladores que inventaron los programas, que contribuyeron a la modernizacion de los procesos de produccion como la aplicacion de la tecnologia CNC en el proceso de produccion de confites.
					
					  En la ceremonia de clausura estuvieron presentes el secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea Choe Thae Bok, el viceprimer ministro del Consejo de Ministros Jon Ha Chol, el presidente del Comite de Educacion Kim Yong Jin, el presidente del Comite Estatal de Ciencias y Tecnologias Ri Ja Bang y otros funcionarios junto con los desarrolladores de programas.
					
					  La palabra de clausura estuvo a cargo de Ri Ja Bang.

articles.title: Pinturas maestras de la epoca del Songun
articles.content:
Pinturas maestras de la epoca del Songun 
Pyongyang, 4 de noviembre (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar con exito en el Palacio de Deportes de Pyongyang la Exposicion Estatal de Bellas Artes en homenaje a la historica Conferencia del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y el 65o aniversario de la fundacion de esta organizacion politica.
					  Estaban exhibidas alli mas de 400 obras de bellas artes que muestran las inmortales hazanas de los tres grandes hombres del monte Paektu acumuladas en la fundacion y desarrollo del PTC y la ardiente fidelidad de todo el ejercito y el pueblo de seguir eternamente al partido.
					
					  La escultura "El Presidente Kim Il Sung proclamando la fundacion del partido" y la pintura al estilo coreano "Madrugada" que describen de modo emocionante al Presidente quien despues de la liberacion del pais (agosto de 1945) fundo el PTC y dedico toda su vida por el pueblo, la pintura al oleo "El Dirigente Kim Jong Il quien produjo un gran jubilo en todo el pais" y otros dibujos describieron en alto nivel ideo-artistico las proezas revolucionarias y los nobles rasgos de los grandes hombres del monte Paektu.
					
					  Tambien, fueron exhibidas numerosas obras de bellas artes que hacen recordar la orgullosa trayectoria del desarrollo del PTC incluyendo las pinturas al estilo coreano "Venerando al sol" y "Carta de peticion de ingreso al Partido del Trabajo de Corea".
					
					  En particular, la pintura al estilo coreano "Noche del puesto militar", la al oleo "De un soplo", etc. reflejan el impetu revolucionario de los militares y civiles coreanos levantados en la construccion de la gran potencia prospera bajo la bandera del Songun, con lo cual fueron calificadas altamente por los visitantes.
					
					  Ademas, atrajeron atencion de los visitantes la pintura al estilo coreano "Alma hacia Huichon", el grabado "Hombres valientes de Huichon", la mannyonhwa (obra de bellas artes hecha con conchas) "Lugar de construccion de la Central Hidroelectrica Orangchon", etc. que reflejan bien la realidad de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea que avanza a pasos firmes bajo la direccion del gran partido.
					
					  Todas las obras exhibidas demostraron claramente la ferrea conviccion y voluntad del ejercito y el pueblo de Corea de llevar a feliz termino la causa revolucionaria del Juche bajo la direccion del gran partido encabezado por el Dirigente.
